If a Java breakpoint does not have its HANDLE_ID attribute filled it, the UI 
will crash if you attempt to view the breakpoint's properties.  (See stack 
trace at end).

There are a few problems with this:

#1 - if the field is required, then it should not be so simple to create a 
breakpoint without it.  The createLineBreakpoint helper, for instance, doesn't 
even document that this might be a useful attribute to set.  If it's required, 
then it should be an argument to the helper.

#2 - it may be impossible to set this attribute if the Java class does not 
exist in the workspace.

I believe that any senders of BreakpointUtils.getType() should tolerate null as 
a return value.
